title: Annual Compliance for Limited Liability Company

sections.heading: LLP Annual Compliance: Easy, Cheap, and On Time
content: Even if there is no business or income, running an LLP requires annual compliance. If you miss a deadline, you could have to pay a lot of late fees and penalties from your partner.
You can focus on your business while our experts take care of all of your LLP's annual compliance needs.

sections.heading: What is the Annual Compliance for LLP?
content: Every Limited Liability Partnership (LLP) in India must file:

points: Annual Return with the MCA
Statement of Accounts and Solvency
Return for Income Tax

sections.heading: Rules
content: These rules must be followed every year, no matter how much money you make or what you do.

sections.heading: Mandatory LLP Annual Filings and Due Dates

points: Form 11: Annual Return - Due on May 30th
Form 8: Statement of Accounts and Solvency - Due on October 30th
ITR-5 (LLP Return) - Due on July 31st
Tax Audit Report (if needed) - Due on September 30th
Keeping books of accounts up to date
Reporting partner contributions
Following the rules even if the LLP has no turnover
Reporting partner and capital on time

sections.heading: Note
content: We take care of everything, and we do it right and on time.

sections.heading: Fees and Penalties for Being Late

points: Form 8 and 11 are late by ₹100 per day
No limit on the penalty
Partners may have to deal with the law
Delay can quickly get very expensive

sections.heading: Frequently Asked Questions about LLP Annual Compliance

list.title: Is it required for an LLP with no business to do annual compliance?
points: Yes. Form 8 and Form 11 must be filed by all NIL turnover or inactive LLPs.

list.title: What happens if you don't follow LLP rules?
points: Late fees are charged every day, with no upper limit, so delays are expensive.

list.title: Is it necessary for LLP to have an audit?
points: Only if the following conditions are met is an audit necessary:
If your turnover is more than ₹40 lakh
Contribution is more than ₹25 lakh

list.title: Is GST part of LLP compliance?
points: If the LLP is GST registered, it must file a GST return separately.
